content:
question from a non-native speaker: is "create route" okay? Or should it be "create a route" or "create routes"?

This refers to opencpn:manual_basic:create_route

Along the same line: the pages on "create a route" and "activate a route" have these titles, but in the the sidebar they appear as "create route" and "activate route"

Speaking of the sidebar: when clicking to Basic manual, I see a different sidebar compared to when I go to a special page. See the two screen shots. Different in layout and different in contents.

Bildschirmfoto-2024-06-14-um-08.01.23.png

Bildschirmfoto-2024-06-14-um-08.01.36.png
Lets title it "Create Routes" . I think that is better.

I changed the title and then tried to change the underlying namespace and ran into problems with indexmenu plugin that had to be fixed. I think that while we are trying the temporary use of a flat TOC sidebar to enable packaging, that we should hold off on changing titles, because I don't want the file structure to blow up on me.
